dict.string: Starting with iPadOS 13 you can have multiple windows and app instances. Open your ${CFBundleDisplayName} accounts side by side, show a file preview in a new window or drag and drop files between two accounts. All windows will be restored, after the app was launched.
On iOS 13 the last opened folder or file will be restored, after the app was launched. On iPadOS 13 all windows will be restored, after the app was launched.
On iPadOS you can control the app with a hardware keyboard. Long press the command key to see all available actions. These actions can change, if an item is selected or not.

The integrated Media Player autoplays all media files from the current folder. The media player was improved, to show available album covers. Furthermore you have now controls, to skip 10 seconds forward or backward. If you have an Apple Watch, you can control the media playback right from your wrist.
We replaced the file preview rendering engine. Now you can display more file types directly in the app. Furthermore you can get better preview icons for more file types.
Now the app is also available in Arabic language
All sort types got a second sort parameter alphabetically.
On iPad the Share Sheet did not appear, if the selected item was out of the first visible file list page
Some file types (Collabora Office) can't be opened or saved via FileProvider
Allows browsing of folders in the File Provider while in Airplane mode with Files app.
Fixes some problems regarding the auto photo and video upload. The app is now more responsive, when uploading a huge amount of files.
Fix: Passcode Lock Screen on iOS 13

Scan your documents directly into your ${CFBundleDisplayName}. You do not longer need a third party app or import scanned documents. Our ${CFBundleDisplayName} app has an integrated document scanner. Tap on the "+" button to start your scan!
Annotate, sign or draw in your PDF files and Images direclty in the app. So easy and all your files stays in your cloud.
On iOS 13 you get great Shortcut support. We have added multiple action, to build your own scripts and automation for your ${CFBundleDisplayName}.
We added some more quick access collections to get faster access to your specific file types.
There is a smaller and cleaner file list layout to show more informations.
The sort bar is now also present in the Directory Picker view.
We fixed the UI restoration, when last opened path no longer exists. Sorry!
On iPad the Share Sheet did not appear, when trying to share a log file.
The Save Action got a new parameter "Overwrite existing File".
Sometimes the edited document was not saved, when edit mode was not disabled.
Fixed some problems, when device is in flight mode.
Fixed a problem, when device was offline and an available offline resource was changed on an other device.
Show and perform actions only, when permission was granted.
With iPadOS 13.4 we supporting mouse and trackpads
Fixed saving, when device is in flight mode.
Open items will be automatically updated if the content was changed
New settings give users more choice and control over their data usage, including which feature can use cellular data and the option to fully disable cellular data usage.

Our new share sheet imports nearly everything from nearly everywhere. Just tap on the share button and select the ${CFBundleDisplayName} app to save multiple files, photos, selected text, downloads and so much more.
Take a photo or video right from the app and upload it to your ${CFBundleDisplayName}.
Easier issue handling through the grouping of identical issues to perform actions on them in bulk.
There is a new option to show folders on top, with the option of keeping the existing behaviour.
A long press on a file list item or right click on your mouse shows a contextual menu.
On iOS 13, users can multi-select items by swiping.
When a re-authentication is needed the app no longer looses focus and authenticates directly from your context.
When media upload is enabled, users can decide between different file name formats.
The app version information in the app settings can be copied to the clipboard for sharing.
New option added to specify different upload folders for instant photo and video uploads. The photo picker can now select items from shared albums.
Media files will be streamed by default, instead of downloading the file first. You can revert to downloading first in the app settings.
When a public link is created, the URL is copied to the clipboard. Public links can now be dragged to another app.
The new diagnostic view shows account informations in the manage view or, if something went wrong, in the state tab for every item. Please enable the diagnostic option in the app settings first.
The total number of items is shown in the footer. The number of selected items is shown on the top.
Open a file directly in the app through an universal link. More information can be found in the app documentation.
In the Shortcuts.app, the action "Get File Info" has two new output parameters, "File ID" and "Local File ID".
Fixes the re-upload of photos upon each modification when instant upload is active
When opening a file for markup, the app immediately switches to edit mode instead of showing the file view first.
Fixes the simultaneous playback of multiple media files when the current media file is loosing focus.
Better accessibility. Some UI elements got polished.
Fixes the failure to open some file types in third party apps in the document browser
Fixes the display of locally downloaded files as items available offline in the Quick Access section
Sort by type works now as expected
View metadata (EXIF, IPTC, Geolocation) on image files.
Two new settings give the user more control over photo uploads: Users can choose to prefer the original photo instead of an edited version and also to upload the raw photo format, if available.
Upload path for photo and video was not visible in settings for some cases.
In some cases the file list was not presented.
Markup mode was not enabled automatically when using iOS 14.
The Shortcuts in-app purchase could not be retrieved.
Share Sheet on iOS 12 could not be dismissed.
Improved performance when selecting multiple items.
Some file types were grayed out and could not be opened.
We made some internal improvements to make everything smoother and removed some edge cases.
The process of creating a public link on a federated share was broken
We supporting all upcoming new display sizes with native screen resolution.
We added access to the favorite items directly from the directory picker.
Now it is easier to rename a filename in the scan view by preselecting the filename.
Saving attachments from iOS Mail.app was broken via the share sheet.
Notifies the user with a notification if authentication fails in File Provider.
A newly created folder in File Provider was not selectable.
Fixed some problems on iOS 14, with unresponsive UI elements.
UI on iPad with iOS 12 does not appeared
Fix: Improvements on Apple Silicon macOS
Fixed a crash and some improvements when running on macOS 11 Apple Silicon
Fixed a crash when selecting an item, which is still uploading
Fixed some problems when uploading items in the background or from the share sheet
A PDF file can be opened in fullscreen view and hides unnecessary UI elements.
Added an option to allow uploading original videos like slow motion, unedited version without re-encoding
We improved our App UI for Right-to-Left languages
The app is using the ownCloud colors and we also polished some UI elements
Show certificate changes in a comparison view
User login to a bookmark is only possible with the same user ID
We improved Drag & Drop and now it is also possible for non local files
Editing the bookmark name was not possible
Fixed some problems with items in stuck
Media Player stopped playing, if there was a non media file item in the folder.
Fixed a crash on startup, when iOS 12 is installed on the device.
A tap on a hyperlink in PDF documents now opens the link.
Fix: PDF thumbnail view on the iPad
Fixed the position of the PDF thumbnail view on the iPad. Now, more PDF content is visible.
In some cases, the message view hid content and also was not selectable.

User can now switch from searching the local folder to a local account-wide search. Search now also supports using custom queries. Search terms and filter keywords can be combined in the search field to get more granular search results.
Added File Provider Actions for Sharing and Public Links
New file provider actions for Sharing and Public Links now will open the UI, allowing users to add or edit Sharing Links and Public Links to the selected item, directly from the file provider.
If the app is protected with a passcode, the file provider extension now presents a user interface for direct unlocking.
Presentation mode opens a file in a full screen detail view, preventing the display from entering sleep mode until the detail view is closed.
Moved "Go to Page" in PDF previews
The "Go to Page" option for PDF files has moved to the Actions menu. It is also available by tapping on the page label.
The PDF view now has additional keyboard shortcuts. Media playback can now be operated entirely with just keyboard commands. Fixed some broken keyboard commands.
The app is now localized in French.
Fix: Shortcut uploads and error handling improvements

Improved error handling for Shortcut actions. Now also reporting authentication errors.
Added an optional "Wait for completion" option to the "Save File" and "Create Folder" action.
Fix: Swiping PDF thumbnail view on the iPhone
The App prevented the page container from scrolling when users tried to scroll inside the pdf thumbnail view on the iPhone
User can now decide do automatically update to a newer file version or to keep the current version in preview mode and we fixed some problems when displaying files.
Previously, in some cases enabling markup mode failed.
Fix: Disable Markup Action for Mime-Type Gif
Disabled markup actions for images with mime type image/gif that can not be edited.
If a passcode is enabled or disabled in the settings, the UI section now gets properly updated.
Fixed a problem in scan view when renaming a file and using a Japanese keyboard layout.
Fix: Added Dark Mode Support to Preview
The preview view is now available in a dark mode theme.
Added an additional URL scheme to open a specific app, if more than one ownCloud apps are installed with different bundle IDs. (owncloud-app, owncloud-emm or owncloud-online)
Fixed misleading warnings at let's encrypt cert renewal
Views in File Provider UI (public links, share with user) could not be dismissed on iOS 12
In some cases, background media upload worked not as expected.
Clipboard support provides copy and paste actions! Use the system-wide clipboard to copy and paste files and content to the ownCloud app or third-party apps!
Uploading new media files is now more reliable in the background when "Use background location updates" is enabled in the settings.
Adopted the filename layout to the new Web UI layout.
Passcode lock supports to set a passcode lock with 4 or 6 digits.
Auto-enabling the markup edit mode on iOS 15 was broken.
The last page of a PDF file could not be opened with the "Go to page" action
Keyboard does not disappear when using the "Go to page" action on the iPad.
Resolving a private link opened via the URL scheme was not successful in some cases.
There is a fresh new look for the single account overview.
When protecting the app with a pin code, biometrical unlock will be suggested as default.
If the users display name is available, it will be shown in the account view, instead of the user name.
Only show background location settings if needed.
There are a lot of improvements under the hood.
Fixed an OAuth2 token refresh problem
Fixed a possible connection problem in the single account view
Fixed bug that prevents changes to PDFs being saved in place.
Fixed continuous audio playback, which stopped after two audio files.
Added a biometrical authentication button to the passcode unlock view. The biomatrical cancel button enables passcode unlock as fallback.
Renaming an account does no longer need a re-authentication
Fixes a bug where media playback failed
We improved the time for the initial scan after setting up a new account
We improved the time for the initial scan after setting up a new account
Improvements when setting up a passcode with biometrical unlock
This version fixes some UI problems on iOS 15.
The shortcuts action Delete Path Item did not provide configured accounts.
Timeout for Copy Action was increased up to 10 minutes.
Shows the contents of the available folders when offline.
Two new dark mode themes are available.
Markup mode was not enabled automatically on iOS 16.
Video player controls were not showing on iOS 16.
Metadata image could overlay the video player canvas.
The passcode lock interval was not taken into use in the share extension.
Support for Spaces, Authenticated WebFinger and other new oCIS features.
Powerful new search UI, saved searches and search templates.
Navigate via the new sidebar, breadcrumbs and browser controls.
The new role-based sharing user interface makes creating and editing shares and links even easier.
Switch between list and several, different grid modes to display your folder's contents in new ways.
Create and edit new documents through app providers on servers that support them.
The updated dark and light themes make use of a new, CSS-based theming system.
Fixed keyboard, media streaming, full screen mode, offline indicator, duplicated sharing option, and UI issues.
Unable to authenticate using OpenID Connect
Fixed File Provider, App Provider and layout issues.
Introducing a new, intuitive account wizard user interface for a fast onboarding experience.
Now you can easily reorder accounts in the sidebar by simply dragging and dropping them.
We have added a location breadcrumb dropdown in the file viewer, making it easier to navigate through your files.
You can now perform text recognition actions on images.
To prevent accidental removal or modification of the suffix for new documents and document scanner files, we have implemented file extension protection.
We have added a new action called "Save to ownCloud" to the share sheet, allowing you to easily save files to your ownCloud account.
You can now enter and edit the name of link shares.
Introducing a new sorting method - “Last Used” - which allows you to sort items based on the most recently accessed ones.
We have fixed the issue that was disabling the edit mode in the markup document view on iOS 17.
We have resolved the issue with opening private links from third-party apps.
We have addressed various issues with the File Provider and the app itself.
Search and Quick Access have been merged into a new, more powerful sidebar item.
Add folders and saved searches directly to the sidebar.
Directly share created links - along with their passwords.
Now supports validating and generating passwords based on server-provided password policies.
We have fixed a bug where the app repeatedly tried to download Available Offline items located on no longer accessible spaces.
Detect attempts to bypass a lock timeout by changing the clock
The app is now compatible with iOS 18.
General app improvements and internal fixes to enhance performance, synchronization, and stability.
Watermarking, screenshot protection and more are now available via MDM and branding.
The File Provider is now more stable thanks to improved memory efficiency.
Watermarking: New MDM Parameters for Customizing Watermark Behavior
